events.comment: Wait for player query to complete.
Query is available, load players and games and find the user's player.
Look for the user's player and assemble the games list.

parameters: "Player found for this user account with id " + VariableString(Player.Id) + "."
"Player found for another user account with id " + VariableString(Player.Id) + "."
"Adding game with id " + VariableString(Player.GameId) + " to games list."
"Updating game with id " + VariableString(Game.Id) + " to a player count of " + ToString(Variable(Game.PlayerCount)) + "."

events.comment: Look for the game with the lowest player count from the 30 most recent games.

parameters: "No game found; creating a new one " + GlobalVariableString(GameId) + "."
"Player not found for this account; creating new player."

events.comment: Check if a nickname is available, if not then hand off to the prompting logic in Connecting Events.
See if the nickname is unique, if not then prompt for another nickname.
Wait for uniqueness query to complete.
Name is unique - move on to updating player.
Name not unique - go back to prompting for nickname.
Update the player information on Firebase.
Wait for the player update to complete.

parameters: "Starting game " + GlobalVariableString(GameId) + " with player " + GlobalVariableString(Nickname) + " (" + GlobalVariableString(PlayerId) + ")."
